snippet: With some big contracts off the ledger, the Mets have money to spend, but they are unlikely to have a payroll of more than $100 million.
abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column on how New York Mets general manager Sandy Alderson says team has plenty to spend now that about $40 million in contracts is coming off the books, but team is unlikely to exceed this year's payroll of about $87 million; examines three conclusions divined by general manager's statements.
lead_paragraph: With some big contracts off the ledger, the Mets have money to spend, but they are unlikely to have a payroll of more than $100 million.

headline.main: The Mets’ Promise of Cash Isn’t a Promise to Spend
headline.print_headline: The Mets’ Promise of Cash Isn’t a Promise to Spend
